Lesson 2: Scenario

Image by Markus Winkler under Unsplash

One of the strongest practices for making the right hire is looking for a candidate who is both the right job fit and the right organization/program fit.

The right job fit candidate has the right skills and experience to actually do the job. The right organization/program fit is the candidate whose values, communication style, and commitment to teamwork match your organization’s culture. Hiring the right person means looking for both of these fits.

An ideal candidate will be a good job fit and a good program fit.

  • Job fit- They have the skills and education to do this job.
  • Organization fit- Their values, attitude, communication style, and teamwork ability match the culture of our program.

When you’re thinking about finding someone who is a job fit and an organization fit, you can use this "Finding the Right Fit "resource to guide you.

Instructions: Use the checklist provided below to help you respond to the activity that follows it.

Who to Hire?

Instructions: Examine the information about "123 Preschool" and review each of the three candidates in the slideshow to figure out who might be a good fit for them. Feel free to use the checklist above to help you decide.

123 Preschool is Hiring!

123 Preschool is looking for a Lead Teacher for the 4-year-old preschool class. The center values hands-on discovery and encouraging children to try new things. The Lead Teacher will be working with 1 assistant teacher and 2 volunteers. Who would you hire?

  • Image by @Syda Productions under Canva

    Candidate 1:

    Mr. Abdullah taught preschool for five years at a private preschool, part of a science magnet school. His references describe him as a “kind teacher who wants his students and co-workers to be successful.”

    Before you go to the next slide for the answer, use the checklist and information about 123 Preschool to determine if he is a good fit.

  • Image by @cgdeaw under Canva

    Correct!

    Mr. Abdullah is a good job fit and a good organization fit for the preschool. He would be a good hire at 123 Preschool.

  • Image by @pondsaksitphotos under Canva

    Candidate 2:

    Ms. Badawi is a gymnastics coach who enjoyed working so much with young students she decided to become a preschool teacher. She’s never taught preschool before. Her references say she’s a great team player who can talk to anyone.

    Before you go to the next slide for the answer, use the checklist and information about 123 Preschool to determine if she is a good fit.

  • Image by @icons8 under Canva

    Maybe!

    Ms. Badawi is a good organizational fit but doesn’t have the experience to be a good job fit. With training, Ms. Badawi could be a good hire.

  • Image by fauxels under Canva

    Candidate 3:

    Mr. Chamas has a variety of work experiences, but he has never taught before. A former manager describes him as “someone who prefers to work alone. While he never had direct conflicts with other staff, his attitude showed he’d rather not work with them.”

    Before you go to the next slide for the answer, use the checklist and information about 123 Preschool to determine if he is a good fit.

  • Image by @brand326597832 under Canva

    Not a good fit!

    Mr. Chamas doesn’t have the skills or the right attitude to work at 123 Preschool. He is not a good fit for the job or the organization.
